column4: Can someone actually TELL me how to fix this instead of linking me to a non-noob-friendly link?
fix what?
apparently I have no fstab file, and I need to create it
how do you know you have no fstab?
I got the job control error, so someone told me to cat /etc/fstab and it said no file/directory exists
try "locate fstab"
the locate said it wasn't found
cd /etc then "ls" are there files there?
modprobe.d, evms.conf, udev
only those?
ok, how did you boot into ubuntu?
so, are you stumped?
as cafuego_ says, you are in busybox probably
well, I have no idea what that is... I am a complete newb
Should I just reinstall Ubuntu?
I didn't have any personal files on it what-so-ever
did it work when you first intalled it?
yes, but about a month ago I started getting this error and I just got around to fixing it
might as well reinstall then
Can I do that with a live CD without booting from the liveCD?
nope
dang, I'll go try again
my liveCD seems to be stuck on "Uncompressing Linux... OK, boothing the Kernal."
